div.p: Philonides to his father, greetings. Please, make sure that [a letter] is written [to the King] from Telestes’ (office). For it will not be the same if Satyros and Abas and [...] praise you. Satyros is in despair [at being relegated to] the position of a servant. Aristoboulos has also come to see me, several times even, and he has told me that he thinks Androitas’ affairs will be given to you. For when the king remembered that [...] not [...] Androitas of the rightful (things/people?) themselves (that Androitas was) able to do, he said: who [...], but [NN] objected that if [...] not sufficiently [...] Translation with slight modifications: B. Van Beek in P.Petr.Kleon, p. 37, © Peeters
